headline: Confirmed: BMC Selects Mukesh Ambani's Reliance To Develop Open Spaces Around Mumbai's Coastal Road
intro: Nearly a year after Mumbai?s Coastal Road was opened to traffic, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has selected Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) to develop 53 hectares of reclaimed open space along the road. The company will take at least three to four months to prepare a plan, following which work on realising new open spaces along the road from Priyadarshini Park to Worli will commence, said sources in the civic body. Initially, the BMC had planned to develop open spaces along the  ?13,000-crore Coastal Road of its own accord. The plan was rolled back due to estimated additional expenditure of  ?400 crore and increased capital expenditure on big ticket projects including north-ward extension of the Coastal Road. Here's all you need to know

imagecaption: BMC Selects Reliance To Develop Open Spaces Around Mumbai's Coastal Road

headline: Nomura raises Nifty target to 26,140 for March 2026, highlights 17 high-conviction stock picks
intro: Nomura has raised its Nifty 50 target to 26,140 for March 2026, citing India's macroeconomic stability and potential. The upgrade reflects a 6% upside and focuses on domestic demand-driven sectors, supported by reforms and liquidity, despite global market uncertainties.
imagecaption: Nomura raises Nifty target to 26,140 for March 2026, highlights 17 high-conviction stock picks

headline: Another PLI scheme hits the Chinese wall, as India now mulls extension for projects under solar module incentive scheme
intro: Industry players in the past few months have also reached out to the ministry of external affairs to relax visa restrictions for technicians which have also impacted project implementation.
imagecaption: The  ?19,500 crore scheme for fully and partially integrated solar PV module manufacturing has scheduled commissioning dates from October 2024 to April 2026.

headline: Sensex, Nifty 50 snap 2-day losing run; investors earn over  ?1 lakh crore? 10 key highlights from Indian stock market
intro: The Sensex closed 321 points, or 0.39 per cent, higher at 81,633.02, with HDFC Bank, Infosys and Reliance Industries as top contributors. The Nifty 50 settled at 24,833.60, up 81 points, or 0.33 per cent.
imagecaption: Fag end buying helped the Sensex and the Nifty 50 end in the green on May 29. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas/File Photo

headline: Castrol India share price rises 5% as reports suggest large corporates may be eyeing BP's lubricant business
intro: Stock Market Today: Castrol India share price gained more than 5% during the morning trade on Thursday as news reports suggested that large corporates like Reliance Industries, Aramco and others may be eyeing BP's lubricant business.
imagecaption: Stock Market Today: Castrol India share price rises more than 5%

headline: Reliance Infra, Va Tech Wabag among 18 micro-cap stocks that surged up to 24% in a week amid stock market volatility
intro: Amid market fluctuations, microcap stocks such as Shilpa Medicare and Va Tech Wabag achieved significant gains. The Nifty Microcap 250 index outperformed the Nifty 50, rising 2.33% over the past week, with Dishman Carbogen Amics, Reliance Infra emerging as top gainers.
imagecaption: Reliance Infra, Va Tech Wabag among 18 micro-cap stocks that surged up to 24% in a week amid market volatility

headline: JioBlackRock Asset Management gets SEBI nod for mutual funds business; appoints Sid Swaminathan as MD & CEO
intro: Jio BlackRock Asset Management and BlackRock received regulatory approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to commence operations as an investment manager for their mutual fund business in India.
imagecaption: JioBlackRock Asset Management also announced the appointment of Sid Swaminathan as it?s Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer (CEO).

headline: Q4 results today: LIC, Info Edge, Minda Corp, Supriya Lifesciences, JK Lakshmi Cement, Rattanindia, Goodyear on May 27
intro: Q4 results on May 27: LIC, Bosch, Info Edge, P&G Hygiene, Minda Corp, JK Lakshmi Cement, and Supriya Lifesciences are among 301 companies to release their earnings report today.
